meta.name: description
meta.content: The Brookings Harbor District 17C Board Members, in partnership with students, parents, staff, and community will cultivate a safe, highly effective learning and collaborative environment where every student can succeed!

Navigating the Student Success Act road map
Visit us at the District Office on Fern Ave.

div.div: Good Afternoon Brookings Harbor Families,
Here are some updates for you as we have now completed our first week of distance learning.

Today, Friday, our food distribution goes until 8 p.m. Starting next week, we will have updated hours of operation from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m on Tuesdays and Fridays in the Brookings-Harbor High School Parking lot.

Since I last spoke to you last week, learning packets, laptop computers, and personal belongings from lockers were distributed to students and their families in various ways. Kalmiopsis will hold another distribution of materials, belongings, and Chromebooks on Tuesday, April 21st, from 1 to 5 pm.

We have created an area WiFi Map that is now available on our website. This interactive map shows current locations in our community where you can connect to the internet. Also on our website, you can find helpful tech support for school-issued laptops.
Please contact your school's office if you have any other questions or to inquire about registering any new students to the district.
Be safe and take care,

Chris Eberhardt
Superintendent

Brookings-Harbor School District 17-C
chrise@brookings.k12.or.us

article.aria-label: CANCELED Kalmiopsis and Azalea Parent Teacher Organization (PTO)

Location: YouTube Livestream of virtual meeting: https://youtu.be/BdLwjs6T4pk
8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Tuesdays and Fridays, BHHS parking lot
(April 17, 2020) - New food hours, WiFi map, and more
This interacrtive Google Map shows the current known locations of Wireless hotspots around our community.

h3.a: BHSD 5 p.m. April 15 Board Meeting Livestream

div.div: Due to the coronavirus/COVID-19 state-wide restrictions, and in keeping with the efforts of social distancing to reduce the spread of the coronavirus/COVID-19, the meeting of the Brookings-Harbor School District 17C Board of Directors will be conducted virtually, rather than in person. If you are a member of the community and wish to provide public comment, please email your comments to dedec@brookings.k12.or.us 24 hours ahead of the meeting and your comments will be part of the public record. You will be able to watch a livestream of the meeting April 15 at 5:00 pm.
Email techsupport@brookings.k12.or.us or call 541-373-7618.
No return to campus classes this school year. Distance education will continue. Graduation guidance for seniors is now available.

h3.a: Food bag distribution ends at 6 PM TODAY

div.div: We expect today’s Tuesday, April 7, event will end early at 6 p.m., rather than the advertised 8 p.m. regular closure time.

span.span: Our district has increased the graduation rate from the 60th percentile to more than 80th percentile in recent years, above the state average. We work to keep our students on track to graduate at all grades levels and have intervention programs to help students who fall behind.

BHHS students can earn an Allied Health Certificate in partnership with SWOCC, CompTIA Professional Information Technology certificates, and numerous Graphic and Digital Media Art professional software certificates. We've also re-added numerous CTE courses, such as welding and construction trades in recent years to provide more "hands-on" vocational training opportunities.

Last year, 184 of our students completed college credits through high school classes. Southern Oregon University (SOU), Oregon Institute of Technology (OIT) and South Western Oregon Community College (SOCC) to provide these dual credit opportunities.

Our district earned three $1.5 million in grants from Business Oregon to retrofit the elementary, middle and high school for safety in the event of a major earthquake. Kalmiopsis Elementary and Azalea Middle School are complete. Brookings-Harbor High School is slated for construction as soon as summer 2019.

div.div: The Brookings-Harbor School District 17C prohibits discrimination and harassment on any basis protected by law, including but not limited to, an individual's perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national or ethnic origin, marital status, age, mental or physical disability, pregnancy, familial status, economic status, veterans' status or any other persons with whom the individual associates. (BHSD Board Policy AC "Anti-Discrimination")
